Class SMTInterpolHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • uniol.apt.analysis.synthesize.separation.SMTInterpolHelper

extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for solving separation problems.

    Uli Schlachter

    • Constructor Detail

      • SMTInterpolHelper

        public SMTInterpolHelper(RegionUtility utility,
                         PNProperties properties,
                         java.lang.String[] locationMap)
        Create a new instance of this class. This prepares an SMTInterpol instance so that Petri nets can be synthesized. It does so by defining a function called 'isRegion'.
        Parameters:
        utility - The region utility for which we are synthesizing.
        properties - The properties that the synthesized net should have.
        locationMap - The location mapping that should be obeyed.
        See Also:
        getScript

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateReachingParikhVector

        public de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term evaluateReachingParikhVector(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term initialMarking,
                                                                                   de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] weight,
                                                                                   State state)
                                                                            throws UnreachableException
        Get a term describing the marking of the given state.
        Parameters:
        initialMarking - A term for the initial marking of the region.
        weight - An array of terms describing the effective weights of transitions.
        state - The state whose marking should be calculated.
        Returns:
        A term describing the marking of the given state.
        Throws:
        UnreachableException - if the given state is unreachable.

      • evaluateParikhVector

        private de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term evaluateParikhVector(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] weight,
                                                                            java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> pv)
        Get a term describing the effect of the given Parikh vector.
        Parameters:
        weight - An array of terms describing the effective weights of transitions.
        pv - The Parikh vector to evaluate.
        Returns:
        A term describing the effect of the vector.

      • requireRegion

        private java.util.List<de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term> requireRegion(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term initialMarking,
                                                                                     de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] weight,
                                                                                     de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] backwardWeight,
                                                                                     de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] forwardWeight)
        Get a list of terms that is required to describe a region.
        Parameters:
        initialMarking - A term representing the initial marking of the region.
        weight - Terms representing the effective weights of transitions.
        backwardWeight - Terms representing the backward weights of transitions.
        forwardWeight - Terms representing the forward weights of transitions.
        Returns:
        A list of terms all together describing a region.

      • requireKBounded

        private java.util.List<de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term> requireKBounded(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term initialMarking,
                                                                                       de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] weight,
                                                                                       int k)
        Add the needed inequalities so that the system may only produce k-bounded regions.
        Parameters:
        initialMarking - A term representing the initial marking of the region.
        weight - Terms representing the effective weights of transitions.
        k - The limit for the bound.
        Returns:
        The needed terms.

      • requirePlainness

        private java.util.List<de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term> requirePlainness(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term initialMarking,
                                                                                        de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] backwardWeight,
                                                                                        de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] forwardWeight)
        Add the needed inequalities so that the system may only produce plain regions.
        Parameters:
        initialMarking - A term representing the initial marking of the region.
        backwardWeight - Terms representing the backward weights of transitions.
        forwardWeight - Terms representing the forward weights of transitions.
        Returns:
        The needed terms.

      • requireTNetOrMarkedGraph

        private java.util.List<de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term> requireTNetOrMarkedGraph(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] weight,
                                                                                                boolean markedGraph)
        Add the needed inequalities so that the system may only produce T-Net/marked graph regions for the given weights. This must be called for both the presets and postsets.
        Parameters:
        weight - Terms representing the weights of transitions.
        markedGraph - If this is true, a marked graph is required, else a T-net.
        Returns:
        The needed terms.

      • requireDistributableNet

        private java.util.List<de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term> requireDistributableNet(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] backwardWeight)
        Add the needed inequalities to guarantee that a distributable Petri Net region is calculated.
        Parameters:
        backwardWeight - Terms representing the backward weights of transitions.
        Returns:
        The needed terms.

        private java.util.List<de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term> requireConflictFree(de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] weight,
                                                                                           de.uni_freiburg.informatik.ultimate.logic.Term[] backwardWeight)
        Generate the necessary inequalities for a conflict free solution.
        Parameters:
        weight - Terms representing the effective weights of transitions.
        backwardWeight - Terms representing the backward weights of transitions.
        Returns:
        The needed terms.
